;

;In 2023, China’s life insurance industry will continue to undergo difficult transformation. In a complex and ever-changing market: Life insurance was a hot seller in the first half of the year due to high interest rates, but the twists and turns in the equity market made life insurance investments suffer. "Integrating newspaper and bank into one" (see Southern Weekend App for details) Perennially deformed? ">;"Big accounts are high and small accounts are constantly rising. Why is the bancassurance business deformed all year round?";) The new regulations have made the bancassurance channel under pressure even more uncertain.

;

;However, life insurance companies are still determined to continue transformation, pursuing efficiency improvements, and are more committed to the blue ocean market of pension insurance and insurance +, and are competing for more considerate customer service upgrades .

;

;Who is leading the race to transformation? Who sticks more to the "customer-centric" strategy? Which company is more transparent and open to the media and the public? Which company pays more attention to compliance? Which company pays more attention to innovation? Based on the principles of objectivity, fairness and science, Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center constructed an evaluation index system for life insurance performance improvement rankings and evaluated the performance of each life insurance company.

;

;Eight major dimensions Fourteen sub-indicators

;

;"Life Insurance Performance Improvement List" Quantitative The qualitative evaluation index system consists of six first-level indicators and fourteen second-level indicators. Among them, the first-level indicators include three quantitative dimensional indicators of "operational capabilities, customer service, and regulatory compliance" and three qualitative dimensional indicators of "business cross-penetration, comprehensive health ecology, and product innovation." The secondary indicators are refined into fourteen sub-indicators. The total weight of the quantitative and qualitative indicators is 70%.

;

;At the same time, the Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center team assigned media factor weights based on the special research on the above-mentioned life insurance companies, and invited an external expert jury to evaluate the participating life insurance companies. The company conducts independent real-name scoring. Both scores have a weight of 15%. Among them, the media factor mainly refers to the openness and transparency of the life insurance company under investigation to media research.

;

;;

;

;(Liang Shuyi/Picture)

;

;Now The specific description of quantitative and qualitative indicators is as follows:

;

;(1) Business capability.

;

;How to judge the management ability of a life insurance company? From the perspective of business model, the business logic of life insurance companies is to collect premiums to form insurance liabilities, use insurance liabilities to invest to form investment assets, and the investment assets generate investment income. Therefore, to evaluate the operating capabilities of a life insurance company, one is to look at its ability to obtain premiums; the other is to look at its investment asset management capabilities. Original premium income is commonly used in the industry to measure the liability capacity of life insurance companies, but the premium income of nine life insurance companies accounts for about 3/4 of the life insurance industry. The life insurance performance list aims to select the best among the best, so the new indicator insurance service income is included in the statistics;. ;

;

;What is insurance service income? According to the explanation in China Ping An’s semi-annual report, insurance service income refers to recognition during the insurance period based on the provision of services, and excludes investment components. Insurance service income reflects the income obtained from engaging in insurance business. In accordance with the provisions of the "Accounting Standards for Business Enterprises No. 25 - Insurance Contracts" (Finance [2020] No. 20) revised and issued on December 24, 2020, listed insurance companies will implement it from January 1, 2023. This regulation is also called the "Chinese version of IFRS 17". Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center found in its survey that, except for China Life and Taikang Life, seven other life insurance companies have applied the new insurance contract standard IFRS17. Under the new accounting standards, insurance business income is replaced by insurance service income, which also leads to a significant reduction in the recognition of premium income of life insurance companies. Life insurance companies with a large proportion of investment savings products and a high proportion of single premiums will be more obviously affected.

;

;In addition, new business value and embedded value measure the insurance company's value, profitability and sustainable development, and the total investment return rate measures investment performance. These three indicators are commonly used indicators in the industry. In summary, the total weight of the four secondary indicators in this dimension is 20%.

;

;(2) Customer service.

;

;The insurance industry is a typical service-intensive industry. How to implement the "customer-centered" development concept, meet the diverse needs of customers, and improve the service quality of the insurance industry are key issues for my country's insurance industry to achieve high-quality development. From the demand side, the age composition and demand of insurance customer groups have changed significantly, and young customers have increasingly higher requirements for insurance services. From the supply side, my country's insurance products are highly homogeneous, with little difference in product pricing and basically similar scopes of liability.

;

;Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center believes that the life insurance industry cannot sell insurance as a "fast-moving consumer goods". Otherwise, large-scale surrenders may occur, and the service attributes of "slow experience" and "slow decision-making" of insurance should be returned. Risk protection is the core function of the insurance industry. To implement "customer-centric", on the one hand, insurance must be renamed insurance and return to the protection function; on the other hand, insurance must be made "value for money" insurance. In other words, we need to make it affordable, worthwhile, convenient and reassuring for consumers. Based on this, Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center has set up three secondary indicators to measure claims settlement amount, average claim settlement timeliness and surrender rate in the customer service dimension. The total weight of the three indicators in this dimension is 15%.

;

;(3) Compliance.

;

;During the "14th Five-Year Plan" period, "standardization" has become the key word for the development of the insurance industry. At present, institutional supervision, behavioral supervision, functional supervision, penetrating supervision and continuous supervision have gradually formed. In 2021, the focus of supervision will be on the top-level design of the reform. In the fields of corporate governance, solvency, and insurance capital utilization, the "Corporate Governance Guidelines for Banking and Insurance Institutions", "Insurance Company Solvency Supervision Rules (II)" and "On Modifying the Parts in the Areas of Insurance Capital Utilization" were released Notice of Normative Documents". In 2022, regulatory agencies will deepen supervision of consumer rights and interests and issue the "Management Measures for the Protection of Consumer Rights and Interests of Banking and Insurance Institutions." This is a basic and programmatic document in the field of consumer rights protection in the banking and insurance industries. In 2023, supervision will shift to the regulation of bancassurance and individual insurance channels, and the "Notice on Regulating Insurance Products in Bank Agency Channels" and "Measures for the Management of Insurance Sales Behavior" will be issued.

;

;Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center sets four sub-indicators in the compliance dimension, among which core solvency adequacy ratio and comprehensive solvency adequacy ratio are key regulatory indicators; insurance The service quality index refers to the 2022 insurance service quality index released by China Banking and Insurance Information Technology Management Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "China Banking and Insurance"); the data on the number of administrative penalties comes from "Sheepdog" - China Financial Industry Compliance Cloud Platform Regulatory data collected by the system from January to September. The total weight of the four sub-indicators of this dimension is 20%.

;

;(4) Business cross-penetration.

;

;This dimension reflects the synergy and cross-selling capabilities of life insurance companies between different business lines. The Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center believes that the growth logic of life insurance institutions has shifted from "scale" to "quality." The “insurance + service” development strategy has become an industry consensus. The weight of this dimension indicator is 5%.

;

;(5) Healthy ecological construction.

;

;The development of pension finance is inseparable from the construction of a comprehensive health ecosystem, because "the elderly are provided for and the sick are treated" are inseparable. Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center evaluates the development of life insurance companies in the field of big health business based on the annual reports or other public information of each life insurance company. The weight of this dimension indicator is 5%.

;

;(6) Product innovation.

;

;This dimension mainly reflects the product development and innovation capabilities of life insurance companies. The weight of this dimension indicator is 5%.

;

;China Life leads the way

;

;Based on the above dimensions and indicator system, and integrating the 2023 results of various life insurance companies Mid-year reports and announcements, as well as data from third-party rating agencies, Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center evaluated 9 insurance companies and obtained a total score of quantitative and qualitative indicators.

;

;Based on media factor weights and external expert review weights, Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center constructed a life insurance performance list.

;

;The results of the list show that China Life, Ping An Life and AIA Life ranked the top three. Among them, China Life and Ping An Life have a clear lead and are the only two life insurance companies on the list with a total score of more than 60 points.

;

;;

;

;(Liang Shuyi/Picture)

;

;Sub-indicator system observation shows that in the quantitative and qualitative indicator scores, China Life, Ping An Life and AIA Life ranked in the top three, and there was a wide gap between the scores of the other six life insurance institutions. There is a nearly ten-point difference in scores between AIA Life in third place and Taiping Life Insurance in fourth place. This shows that the first-tier life insurance companies have a larger lead.

;

;In the scores of the expert jury, the expert judges favored Ping An Life Insurance. The company was the only life insurance company to receive a score of 9. In the media factor, AIA Life, PICC Life and China Pacific Insurance failed to respond within the limited time for some reason and did not score, which in turn affected the overall score to a certain extent.

;

;Observed from different dimensions, China Life, Ping An Life and PICC Life ranked the top three. China Life's 2023 interim report did not apply the new insurance contract standards, but replaced insurance service income with insurance business income, so there is an overestimation to a certain extent. However, China Life’s third quarter report for 2023 shows that its insurance service revenue reached 136.439 billion yuan, only slightly lower than Ping An Life’s 168.945 billion yuan. Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center calculated and found that the adjustment did not affect China Life's ranking in the life insurance performance list.

;

;Why does China Life top the list? China Life has obvious advantages on the liability side. China Life's third quarterly report shows that in the first three quarters of 2023, the scale and growth rate of premium income, new policy premiums, and first-year regular premiums all hit new highs for the same period in the past three years. First-year regular premiums with ten years or more were RMB 44.639 billion, a year-on-year increase of 15.4%, accounting for 42.12% of first-year regular premiums; new business value continued to grow in the first three quarters of 2023, with a year-on-year increase of 14.0%.

;

;From an asset perspective, declining investment returns are a common problem in the industry. Against the backdrop of downward shifts in interest rates and fluctuations in the equity market, investment returns in the insurance industry have generally declined. Data from China Chengxin International shows that in 2022, the life insurance industry's investment return rate will drop to 3.8%, a decrease of 0.6 percentage points from 2021, which is significantly lower than the industry's average investment return rate of 5.3% in the past ten years. Therefore, the overall score for this indicator is low, with PICC Life scoring the highest because it uses group data.

;

;China Life performs well in the customer service dimension. In terms of sub-indicators, China Life’s three indicators are all at the leading level in the industry. Data from the company's 2023 interim report show that the average claim settlement timeframe is 0.39 days, a year-on-year increase of 17%; "claims prepayment" exceeded 74 million yuan; "claims direct payment" exceeded 3.41 million; "one-day critical illness compensation" compensation amount exceeded 5.4 billion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 50%.

;

;At the same time, China Life does not fall behind in terms of regulatory compliance. In terms of sub-indicators, the company's core solvency adequacy ratio reached 140%, and its comprehensive solvency adequacy ratio reached 204%, both well above regulatory requirements and at the average level among the nine life insurance companies. In the 2022 Insurance Service Quality Index released by China Banking and Information Technology, China Life received a high score of 94.61, which is higher than the average level of 85.28 in the personal insurance industry.

;

;However, according to data from "Sheepdog", a compliance cloud platform for China's financial industry, China Life was fined 47 times (including branches) in the first three quarters, a high On average 29 times. Because China Life has a large business volume and many branches, this indicator does not mean that the company's compliance is lower than that of other peers.

;

;Develop pension finance and cultivate new growth poles

;

;In the midst of high-quality transformation of life insurance companies Nowadays, as the core component of the third pension pillar, pension insurance is becoming a strategic insurance type.

;

;Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center believes that pension finance has huge potential. The three-dimensional indicators of business cross-penetration, comprehensive health ecological construction and product innovation reflect the development of pension finance of life insurance companies to a certain extent. However, the disclosure standards of various life insurance companies are not uniform because they are in the exploratory period. Therefore, Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center conducts evaluations based on the annual reports of each life insurance company and with reference to various information such as announcements and publicity.

;

;The results of the list show that although Ping An Life ranks second in the total score of the list, it scores first in the three qualitative indicators. China Life Second, AIA Life, Taiping Life and Sunshine Life tied for third.

;

;Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center also found in its survey that nine life insurance companies are actively participating in the construction of pension finance. Among them, China People's Pension Insurance Co., Ltd., China Life Pension Insurance Co., Ltd., and Taiping Pension Insurance Co., Ltd. are the first batch of pension insurance companies designated by the State Financial Supervision and Administration Bureau to participate in the commercial pension pilot. The pilot is about to be completed for one year.

;

;Other life insurance companies are also actively exploring pension finance business. For example, Ping An Life relies on the resources of Ping An Group of China to continue to make efforts in the direction of "insurance + services". In terms of "insurance + health", Ping An Life launched the "Ping An Zhenxiang RUN" health service plan. In the first three quarters of 2023, Ping An Life has served more than 19 million customers, a year-on-year increase of more than 10%; in the "insurance + high-quality health care community" In terms of "Ping An Life Insurance", Ping An Life has teamed up with other professional companies within the group to build a high-quality health care brand "Zhen Yi Nian". In October 2023, Ping An Zhenyi Nian officially released Wellness Care 3.0, launching two new benefits: residence and CCaH (Continuing Care at Home).

;

;In terms of "insurance + home care", Ping An Life continues to explore home care services. As of the end of September 2023, Ping An's home care services have covered 54 cities across the country, with a total of more than 70,000 people qualified for home care services, and more than 50% of policyholders in 54 cities have activated their home service rights.

;

;Taikang Life has formed a collaboration with 20 "Taikang Homes" across the country and has become an industry benchmark. Sunshine Life will start with the Sunshine Family (Guangzhou) health care community and gradually deploy a chain of CCRC senior care communities across the country.

;

;Southern Weekend New Financial Research Center believes that the integration of medical and nursing care is a general trend, and "insurance + services" is becoming a new blue ocean. All life insurance companies should continue to innovate in products and services. On the one hand, they should enrich product connotations and expand the coverage of insurance products; on the other hand, they should extend the value chain of insurance services and provide comprehensive services such as health management, medical services, and long-term care.

;According to "Half Moon Talk", the reporter was in a county in Wumeng Mountain District During the investigation, it was found that the county’s total wage guarantee budget expenditure for the year was 2.63 billion, including 2 billion for in-service personnel, 170 million for retired personnel, and 460 million for temporary personnel. The number of temporary employees is 1.8 times that of in-service employees, but the total salary budget of the former is less than a quarter of the latter. In addition, the county's total salary expenditures for temporary employees have exceeded the county's total tax revenue. In several neighboring districts and counties of the county, the average number of temporary employees is 1.7 times that of in-service employees.
;

;

;Specifically, the per capita annual income of temporary employees in the county is about 16,100 yuan, and the total number of employees is 28,806; the per capita annual income of current employees is about 12.83 million, and the total number of personnel is 15,580. The per capita annual income of current employees is eight times that of temporary employees.

;

;How do you view this phenomenon?

;

;First of all, the county has been completely reduced to "food finance". The total annual salary budget for temporary staff is 460 million, which has exceeded the county's total tax revenue, which means that the county's economic strength and endogenous fiscal capacity are very weak. Against the background that the sluggish housing market has stalled land finance, especially in small localities, the total annual budget expenditure of 2.63 billion on guaranteed wages will most likely come from transfer payments.

;

;As for the economically developed areas that currently provide sources of transfer payments, their finances are not sufficient or even very difficult. It is impossible to maintain the "food finance" for a long time by relying on transfer payments. , the county may have to slim down: reductions in personnel, staff, budgets, and expenditures are inevitable.

;

;Secondly, the so-called on-the-job personnel are formal workers with a formal establishment; the so-called temporary personnel are temporary workers and contract workers without a permanent establishment. If we have to reduce headcount, which category of people will be eliminated first? From the perspective of effectiveness and efficiency, how should redundant staff be eliminated?

;

;The answer to the first question is obvious. In the case of financial difficulties, unemployed personnel will be laid off first. This is also a common practice everywhere. It’s called “clearing out temporary workers.”

;

;The reason is very simple: the principle of minimum action. In theory, there is no iron rice bowl anymore. The current "Civil Service Assessment Regulations (Trial)" has annual assessments, and the results are divided into four grades: excellent, competent, basically competent and incompetent. "The annual assessment for two consecutive years is determined to be Those who are found to be incompetent will be dismissed." But in fact, unless a major principled error is made, it is very difficult to lay off an employee with a civil servant or a public institution, and few leaders are willing to be evil and "smash people's jobs" and are worried about being sacked. The job holder or his family may cause trouble, be unsightly, and have a "bad influence." But it's different for temporary workers without official establishment. They are mentally prepared to be laid off due to the company running out of money or the superior's request.

;

;So, should temporary workers be eliminated (first)? Before answering this question, you must understand why the company recruits temporary workers.

;

;Temporary workers are different from temporary workers.

;

;One ​​is that there is a relationship, but the relationship is not strong enough and it is not enough to get the establishment in one step. First, recruit people to make a temporary transition and wait for the internal opportunity to become a regular employee. Banyuetan reporter's investigation found that the recruitment and management of most temporary personnel are not handled by a unified department and are basically carried out according to the principle of "who employs people, who recruits them" without approval or approval from the establishment department, finance department, organization department, human resources and social security department. The registration and recruitment procedures are relatively haphazard, with the phenomenon of disorderly growth in quantity and unguaranteed quality, and it is difficult to eliminate recruitment based on personal relationships and relationships.

;

;The other type is irrelevant or almost irrelevant. They are recruited to do the dirty and tiring work that regular workers are unwilling to do. , hard work and troublesome work, you may be pushed out to take the blame if something goes wrong.

;

;There are also many internal contradictions in such units: on the one hand, formal workers get more money, good benefits, but work less, and there are various ways to obtain honors and Opportunities for promotion; on the other hand, temporary workers who work receive less money, poor benefits, and more work. If something goes wrong, they will be pushed out to take the blame. With such a close contrast, the latter's psychology will be very unbalanced.

;

;However, if we look at the logic of the market, temporary workers are paid market prices; for the same position, regular workers are paid more than temporary workers. Part of it is the premium brought by the preparation. When multiple people compete for an organization, they compete for the premium.

;

;Public people think that when "retiring temporary workers", the first type of eviction is to let those who do not work leave to improve efficiency, but in fact The second type is often eliminated, which is to let the temporary workers leave. It doesn't matter and they are hard-working, so there is the least resistance to the elimination. However, after they are dismissed, the regular workers often complain because someone has to do the work. After laying off these many people, work can still be done. In this sense, efficiency has been improved.

;

;Finally, government functions should be viewed from the perspectives of government and market/society. Government management should also live within its means: a county's tax revenue is less than 500 million a year, and the total budgeted expenditure on guaranteed wages is 2.63 billion. The county has been financially exhausted. Do we really need so many people, spend so much money, and take care of so many things?

;

;We should sort out: which management and service functions are absolutely necessary and can only be performed by the government, and what budget and staff size are appropriate; which ones can be abolished to allow Society manages itself; what is considered excessive regulation or improper regulation stifles economic vitality? Even if a county has too many net outflows of people and its population and economic scale continue to shrink, then merging counties is also a good choice, and merging villages It has been practiced in many places such as , , towns and villages, reducing the scale of government and releasing market vitality.

;

;In addition, it is because civil servants have become the de facto iron rice bowl and the premium brought by the establishment is very high, that’s why everyone has such a big interest in the public examination preparation. enthusiasm. If we can implement the annual assessment of civil servants and public institutions, and dare to fire veterans who only get paid but do not work like market-oriented enterprises, and reduce the premium brought by the establishment to zero, everyone will be more rational about the public examination preparation. .

;

;There is another way to compress or even eliminate the premium brought by staffing: marketize job salaries and see how much the temporary workers recruited from the market are paid. Then the salary of regular workers is as close as possible to that of temporary workers, so as to squeeze out the premium of establishment. Cleaners in a certain place have a staff. Cleaners with staff hire people to do their work and then enjoy the price difference. This difference is the premium brought by the staff. The government or taxpayers were taken advantage of and spent more money.
